thread.title: Moussa Dembele insists he has consigned hat-trick against Rangers to back of his mind ahead of Old Firm clash
thread.title_full: Moussa Dembele insists he has consigned hat-trick against Rangers to back of his mind ahead of Old Firm clash

author: James Whaling
title: Moussa Dembele insists he has consigned hat-trick against Rangers to back of his mind ahead of Old Firm clash
text:
Dembele after his hat-trick against Rangers (Photo: PA Wire) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Celtic striker Moussa Dembele insists he has consigned his hat-trick against Rangers to the back of his mind as the Old Firm rivals prepare to do battle again on Sunday. 
He came on as a substitute for the injured Leigh Griffiths in his first Glasgow derby in September and left with the match ball following the 5-1 win. 
Dembele netted in his next two appearances against Rangers and has taken his tally for the season to 32, picking up the Premiership player of the month award for February. 
"It was a big moment in my Celtic career," he said on his treble earlier in the campaign. 
"It was my first hat-trick as a professional footballer and my first league goals too for Celtic. Dembele completes his hat-trick (Photo: PA Wire) The striker celebrates with Celtic's fans (Photo: Reuters) 
"It is all about opportunities. 
"I try to take mine when the gaffer gave me a chance to play and since then I have tried to give 100 per cent in training and in games to stay on the pitch. 
"It was a good day to remember but it has gone now and we have another game on Sunday. 
"As a young kid you dream of being part of games like this and now I am so I will just enjoy the moment and show what I can do. 
"I am looking forward to the Rangers game as I have been looking forward to every other game. 
"We have to make sure we prepare like we prepare for every other game." Dembele has taken his tally for the season to 32 (Photo: PA Wire) 
Dembele, who cost Celtic a reported Â£500,000 when he made the move from Fulham, has been tipped for a call up to the France senior side for the World Cup qualifier against Luxembourg on March 25. 
The in-form forward also scored four goals for the French Under-21 side - including a double against England late last year - and was named as his country's best young player of 2016 in December. 
However, he does not believe Sunday's match is necessarily the chance to clinch his place in the French squad. 
He said: "I would say I am not far from it. I will try to keep working and it will come when it comes but I don't think about it. 
"I have a big game on Sunday. People will know what I am capable of. It is not just about this game, it is about what I have done throught the season. 
"We will see what happens next week but first we have to take the three points." poll loading What will the result be in the Old Firm derby? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
